Description: Limestone stela of Decree of Teti: the stela contains nine lines of text, carved in simple incised hieroglyphs, comprising a decree of the King Teti concerned with the freeing of temple-land from local taxes. It contains the name of one official, the ỉmy-r Šm‘w, Ny-kʒw-'Izzỉ. In many places the surface of the stone is so worn that only occasional traces of signs can be seen. There is great difficulty in deciding in some cases whether the visible marks represent traces of signs or not. The only significant change is in the date where the reading 'ʒbd 4' seems certain. The stone is hard but the surface has suffered much from rubbing. There is no colour.
Curator's comments: The text given here presents few changes from that given by K. Sethe in 'Urkunden der 18. Dynastie' Bd.1 (Leipzig, 1914), pp. 207-8. Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 40.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.31)
Condition: Poor; the stone is hard but the surface has suffered much from rubbing.
Associated places: Named in inscription: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos)
